column1: Smoque BBQ////Regardless of what some Chicago food critics may say about the brisket here
column2: it's nothing like Texas brisket. The main problem as I see it is that they are using an electric smoker and it just doesn't impart the fragrance or texture of a smoker that gets it's heat from a wood source. I honestly feel like they should create another category called electricue to describe what those things produce. The brisket is juicy but frankly I find it to be a little bland and not quite crusty enough on the outside. I like mine fattier too but I realize that may be more subjective. The ribs were good
column3: very good. The beans were sweet
column4: tangy and delicious. The mac and cheese was kind of clotted but the taste was OK.
